field.name: LoanID
field.description: A unique identifier for each loan

field.name: Income
field.description: The annual income of the borrower

field.name: LoanAmount
field.description: The amount of money being borrowed

field.name: CreditScore
field.description: The credit score of the borrower

field.name: MonthsEmployed
field.description: The number of months the borrower has been employed

field.name: NumCreditLines
field.description: The number of credit lines the borrower has open

field.name: InterestRate
field.description: The interest rate for the loan

field.name: LoanTerm
field.description: The term length of the loan in months

field.name: Education
field.description: The highest level of education attained by the borrower

field.name: EmploymentType
field.description: The type of employment status of the borrower

field.name: MaritalStatus
field.description: The marital status of the borrower

field.name: HasMortgage
field.description: Whether the borrower has a mortgage

field.name: HasCoSigner
field.description: Whether the loan has a co-signer

field.name: Default
field.description: Indicate whether the loan defaulted or not

name: Loan Default Prediction Dataset
description: ## Introduction > Financial loan services are leveraged by companies across many industries, from big banks to financial institutions to government loans. One of the primary objectives of companies with financial loan services is to decrease payment defaults and ensure that individuals are paying back their loans as expected. In order to do this efficiently and systematically, many companies employ machine learning to predict which individuals are at the highest risk of defaulting on their loans, so that proper interventions can be effectively deployed to the right audience. ## Description > This dataset has been taken from Coursera's [Loan Default Prediction Challenge](https://www.coursera.org/projects/data-science-coding-challenge-loan-default-prediction) and will provide you the opportunity to tackle one of the most industry-relevant machine learning problems with a unique dataset that will put your modeling skills to the test. The dataset contains 255,347 rows and 18 columns in total. ## Features ![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F5934442%2F4601b71040400d531d38ba6db2d59a29%2Floan_desc.png?generation=1694520603948387&alt=media) > **Image credits:** Image by vectorjuice on Freepik Please, provide an upvote👍if the dataset was useful for your task. It would be much appreciated😄
